paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Patients aged 18–75 years, predominantly of Portuguese descent.
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloid polyneuropathy (ATTRv-PN) with biopsy-confirmed amyloid deposits.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive neuropathy with sensory and motor impairment.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with stage 1 (able to walk without support) sensorimotor or autonomic neuropathy, aged 18–75 years, with documented Val30Met mutation.
Patients with documented Val30Met mutation and biopsy confirmed amyloid deposits.

functional_data.summary: Tafamidis treatment stabilizes TTR and slows disease progression.

variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most common variant associated with ATTRv-PN.
key_quotes: ATTRv is caused by mutations in the transthyretin (TTR) gene.
Patients with documented Val30Met mutation and biopsy confirmed amyloid deposits.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of Tafamidis Clinical Trials and Open-Label Extension Studies

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from both the main text and the table.
